content:
• Friday, May 11, 2012
  • CHK

    How Chesapeake (CHK -13.8%) managed to crush longs and shorts within a 30-minute span: After...

    How Chesapeake (CHK -13.8%) managed to crush longs and shorts within a 30-minute span: After filing that “additional time is needed" to complete its Q1 report, it actually filed the Q1 within minutes. A massive short covering spree ensued, the stock gyrated wildly, but reality finally set in: CHK may need to delay asset sales it needs to fund its potential $6B spending gap.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK -13.9%) may have to delay some of the $14B in asset sales planned for...

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK -13.9%) may have to delay some of the $14B in asset sales planned for this year because low natural gas prices may hurt its ability to comply with credit covenants, the company says in an SEC filing today. (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 20 Comments
  • NES

    Bargain hunters may be taking note of insider cluster buying at Heckmann (HEK +7.9%), where four...

    Bargain hunters may be taking note of insider cluster buying at Heckmann (HEK +7.9%), where four different company directors and officers purchased 31,738 shares at an average price of $3.58/share during May 8-10. The move could be viewed as an indication the stock is undervalued; earlier this week, shares had touched a 52-week low.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM | 8 Comments
  • CIEN

    Ciena (CIEN +8.4%) shares surge as Verizon (VZ +1.5%) says it is using Ciena technology as part...

    Ciena (CIEN +8.4%) shares surge as Verizon (VZ +1.5%) says it is using Ciena technology as part of its plans to build additional control panel technology into its network infrastructure. Citi says the news allays concerns that CIEN's technology isn't being accepted by customers and should give investors better confidence in its long-term growth opportunities.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • FRAN

    Shares of Francesca's Holdings (FRAN -12.1%) move down sharply on chatter the company may float...

    Shares of Francesca's Holdings (FRAN -12.1%) move down sharply on chatter the company may float another secondary offering. In April, management and directors sold 9M shares in an offering.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM
  • MDR

    McDermott (MDR +16%) is one of today's major movers after its better than expected Q1 assures...

    McDermott (MDR +16%) is one of today's major movers after its better than expected Q1 assures analysts the company is returning to normal levels of profitability with strong growth in operating margin, ensuring it will be able to meet earnings goals. Revenue came in light but a Q1 $5.8B backlog of work should make up for that over time.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • ET-OLD

    Investors think ExactTarget's (ET-OLD +5.8%) Q1 results hit a bulls-eye, as the provider of...

    Investors think ExactTarget's (ET-OLD +5.8%) Q1 results hit a bulls-eye, as the provider of cloud-based online marketing software beat EPS estimates by $0.25 (-$0.15 vs -$0.40 estimate) and posted a 45% revenue gain. Citing ET's upward guidance, Canaccord sees "several quarters of open field growth prospects in its core North American email market."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • DVA

    Today's weakness in DaVita (DVA -1.7%) shares perhaps is attributable to a NY Times article...

    Today's weakness in DaVita (DVA -1.7%) shares perhaps is attributable to a NY Times article describing how a shift by the U.S. government in how it pays for drugs to treat dialysis patients may have resulted in a jump in blood transfusions for patients who now may not be getting enough of the medications.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM

  • It's deja-vu all over again: Reminiscent of how Coca-Cola got skittish when rumors of a Monster...

    It's deja-vu all over again: Reminiscent of how Coca-Cola got skittish when rumors of a Monster Beverage buyout sent shares flying, now a report is out quoting sources who say LinkedIn isn't interested in buying Monster Worldwide after all. MWW +14.4%, as it takes a turn to the south.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • RNDY

    Shares of Roundy's (RNDY -14.4%) after the grocery store chain reports slumping Q1 earnings...

    Shares of Roundy's (RNDY -14.4%) after the grocery store chain reports slumping Q1 earnings which it (rather creatively) partially pins on the Green Bay Packers' early playoff exit. Moving forward, the company sees sales increasing 3%-5% - but forecasts same-store sales will decline by 0.5% to 1.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM | 3 Comments
  • DAR

    Darling International (DAR -3.9%) slips after its Q1 results missed estimates late yesterday....

    Darling International (DAR -3.9%) slips after its Q1 results missed estimates late yesterday. Net profit fell 39% Y/Y as lower raw material volumes and lower finished product prices weighed on bottom line margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM
  • WEB

    Web.com Group (WWWW -2.6%) recovers some of its earlier losses today after pricing its 8M share...

    Web.com Group (WWWW -2.6%) recovers some of its earlier losses today after pricing its 8M share secondary offering at $15.25, a 1.7% discount to Thursday's closing price.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • MWW

    Monster Worldwide (MWW+18.1%) is receiving interest from a number of potential buyers after...

    Monster Worldwide (MWW+18.1%) is receiving interest from a number of potential buyers after launching a strategic review in March, according to Reuters. While no offer is reported to be on the table yet, the company is preparing data for potential bidders to review. (Previous: LinkedIn, Silver Lake in the mix)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • MWW

    Shares of Monster Worldwide (MWW +17.1%) soar off a report that LinkedIn (LNKD -1.1%) and Silver...

    Shares of Monster Worldwide (MWW +17.1%) soar off a report that LinkedIn (LNKD -1.1%) and Silver Lake might be putting together bids for the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM | 2 Comments
  • SNE

    Sony (SNE -7.5%) ADRs take a hit after the Japanese conglomerate reported its fourth straight...

    Sony (SNE -7.5%) ADRs take a hit after the Japanese conglomerate reported its fourth straight annual loss overnight. The company also noted, without significant impact however, that it expects swing to profit in FY12.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM | 4 Comments
  • QRVO

    TriQuint Semiconductor (TQNT +2.1%) move up after a SEC filing shows that insider Scott Gibson...

    TriQuint Semiconductor (TQNT +2.1%) move up after a SEC filing shows that insider Scott Gibson has been snapping up shares this week.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM
  • GWAY

    Greenway Medical Technologies (GWAY +20%) surges after blowing out FQ3 estimates late yesterday....

    Greenway Medical Technologies (GWAY +20%) surges after blowing out FQ3 estimates late yesterday. Total revenue jumped by over 50% on strong sales, while bottom line margins were helped by better cost controls.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM
  • DVCR

    Advocat (AVCA +70.8%) soars after receiving a buyout offer by Covington Investments, a privately...

    Advocat (AVCA +70.8%) soars after receiving a buyout offer by Covington Investments, a privately owned provider of long-term care services in Florida, Ohio and Tennessee, for $8.50 per share in cash.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • ADY

    After cruising to a huge gain yesterday off of its strong Q1 report, Feihe International (ADY...

    After cruising to a huge gain yesterday off of its strong Q1 report, Feihe International (ADY -20.1%) falls almost all the way back down on frenzied momentum trading not tied to any particular news out from the Chinese milk powder producer.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 2 Comments
  • CHK

    Chesapeake (CHK -2.2%) update: CEO McClendon has received $108M for his minority stakes in wells...

    Chesapeake (CHK -2.2%) update: CEO McClendon has received $108M for his minority stakes in wells the company has sold. CHK had previously said entities controlled by McClendon were parties to a 2011 deal in which the company sold certain assets, but it had not said how much McClendon and limited liability companies he controls earned in this or other deals.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM | 15 Comments
  • PII

    Shares of Polaris Industries (PII +4.2%) show strength after Bespoke's Paul Hickey identifies it...

    Shares of Polaris Industries (PII +4.2%) show strength after Bespoke's Paul Hickey identifies it as a defensive stock with limited exposure to Europe.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • NP

    Neenah Paper's (NP +6.3%) Q1 revenues missed estimates while earnings beat expectations, as...

    Neenah Paper's (NP +6.3%) Q1 revenues missed estimates while earnings beat expectations, as margins for its fine paper segment were the second highest since early 2007. Buckingham Research raises its stock rating to Buy from Neutral and increases its full-year EPS estimate.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM
  • NFLX

    Shares of Netflix (NFLX +6.6%) trade higher on enthusiasm kicked up by an insider buy and a...

    Shares of Netflix (NFLX +6.6%) trade higher on enthusiasm kicked up by an insider buy and a survey showing the company isn't quite as annoying as it once was to consumers. After its clumsy handling of its decision to split its DVD and streaming business set the customer satisfaction bar low, the company is now trending higher - although its still trails Amazon and Apple by a fair distance.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM | 4 Comments
  • PEIX

    Pacific Ethanol (PEIX -11.8%) announces a wider loss in Q1, as a boost in revenues was...

    Pacific Ethanol (PEIX -11.8%) announces a wider loss in Q1, as a boost in revenues was diminished by reduced margins. Net losses were $0.06/share vs. consensus breakeven of two analyst estimates; revenues rose 14% Y/Y to $198M vs. $252M consensus. PEIX's application for E15 registration was recently approved by the EPA; E15 is a mix of 85% gasoline, 15% ethanol.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • OILT

    Oiltanking Partners (OILT +3.1%) subsidiary Bulk Handling USA acquires a 100% interest in United...

    Oiltanking Partners (OILT +3.1%) subsidiary Bulk Handling USA acquires a 100% interest in United Bulk Terminal, which OILT calls the largest dry bulk export terminal on the Gulf Coast and is considered a "critical logistic link in coal and petroleum coke international supply chains." Financial terms were not disclosed.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • HOG

    Harley-Davidson (HOG -4.7%) trades lower after Citi warns that its channel checks indicate April...

    Harley-Davidson (HOG -4.7%) trades lower after Citi warns that its channel checks indicate April and early May motorcycle sale slowed significantly to a 1%-3% range after skyrocketing 29% in March. The full-May/June numbers may tell the true story due to the volatile nature of motorcycle buying trends.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • FIO

    Fusion-io (FIO +7.2%) surges on a rumor it turned down a $33/share offer from DELL-OLD. A Dell...

    Fusion-io (FIO +7.2%) surges on a rumor it turned down a $33/share offer from DELL-OLD. A Dell spokesperson refuses comment.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX +5.1%) pops after Director Jay Hoag, also founding general partner of Technology...

    Netflix (NFLX +5.1%) pops after Director Jay Hoag, also founding general partner of Technology Crossover Ventures, recently bought 200K shares. The purchases occurred on May 8 and 9 at prices of $71.20-$74.39, worth ~$14.5M; before these buys, Hoag had been a seller in the $100-$270 range.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • SBUX

    Coffee stocks trade higher after reports from Brazil on this year's Arabica crop point to lower...

    Coffee stocks trade higher after reports from Brazil on this year's Arabica crop point to lower wholesale prices. Advancers: SBUX +1.4%, PEET +0.2%, DNKN +2.5%, CBOU +2.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM | 1 Comment
  • CHK

    Chesapeake's (CHK -1.7%) use of off-balance sheet liabilities via "volumetric production...

    Chesapeake's (CHK -1.7%) use of off-balance sheet liabilities via "volumetric production payments" is considered accepted practice in energy production, prompting FT's Izabella Kaminska to wonder if CHK is just the first of many to have these deals outed. "If banks were willing to do such deals for Chesapeake... who’s to say other companies are not saddled with similar liabilities?"

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM | 11 Comments
  • CECO

    A worrying drop in enrollment and revenue in Career Education's (CECO -10.1%) Q1 is enough to...

    A worrying drop in enrollment and revenue in Career Education's (CECO -10.1%) Q1 is enough to spill over to taint other education stocks. Sector decliners: APOL -3.3%, EDMC -2.4%, APEI -8.1% on its own tepid forecast, DV -2.1%, COCO -3.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM
  • SOL

    ReneSola (SOL +7.8%) shares surge as Q1 revenues at the Chinese maker of solar products fell at...

    ReneSola (SOL +7.8%) shares surge as Q1 revenues at the Chinese maker of solar products fell at a slower-than-expected pace, thanks in part to demand from Europe, and the company said Q2 revenue would total at least $200M vs. $178M consensus. Some solar peers also move up: STP +3.1%, LDK +2.7%, TSL +2.7%, YGE +2.3%, JASO +1.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • JWN

    Goldman Sachs maintains a Buy rating on Nordstrom (JWN -3.1%) after digesting the company's...

    Goldman Sachs maintains a Buy rating on Nordstrom (JWN -3.1%) after digesting the company's below-par Q1 report. Despite trimming earnings estimates on JWN, Analyst Adrianna Shapira latches on to the potential for revenue gains off of successful Nordstrom investments.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • SVVC

    Shares of Firsthand Technology Value Fund (SVVC -2.3%) fall lower on concerns big institutional...

    Shares of Firsthand Technology Value Fund (SVVC -2.3%) fall lower on concerns big institutional orders for Facebook won't be piling in. Fellow Facebook play GSV Capital (GSVC -10.4%) could see some of the same jitters on top of a secondary offering of 6M shares priced at $16.25 a pop by the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE -4.5%) cuts FY12 sales guidance to $145-175M from $230-$300M, citing...

    A123 Systems (AONE -4.5%) cuts FY12 sales guidance to $145-175M from $230-$300M, citing previously announced issues with its battery modules. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:35 AM
  • QTWW

    Oh my: Quantum Fuel Systems' (QTWW -8%) President/CEO Alan Niedzwiecki and Chairman Dale...

    Oh my: Quantum Fuel Systems' (QTWW -8%) President/CEO Alan Niedzwiecki and Chairman Dale Rasmussen step down abruptly and without explanation. Quantum, which makes hybrid propulsion and energy-storage technologies, says its CFO will take over the CEO role, and its controller will step into the CFO role.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM
  • GSVC

    Shares of GSV Capital (NASDAQ:GSVC) fall 11.4% in premarket trading after word breaks that...

    Shares of GSV Capital (NASDAQ:GSVC) fall 11.4% in premarket trading after word breaks that demand for Facebook's IPO is weak from institutional investors. SA author Brad Ginesin cuts to the chase on GSVC, saying don't buy the stock on the Facebook hype.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM | 2 Comments
  • ARNA

    Premarket gainers: ARNA +93%. GV +45.5%. ATHX +15%. AVG +12%. ZOOM +9%. MDR +9%. SOL +8%. NVDA...

    Premarket gainers: ARNA +93%. GV +45.5%. ATHX +15%. AVG +12%. ZOOM +9%. MDR +9%. SOL +8%. NVDA +8%.
    Losers: RNDY -11%. PBTH -11%. DAR -9%. JPM -8.5%. SNE -8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • ALR

    Alere (NYSE:ALR) -12.5% premarket after revealing talks with the FDA related to concerns about...

    Alere (NYSE:ALR) -12.5% premarket after revealing talks with the FDA related to concerns about quality testing and performance characteristics on Alere Triage products. The maker of medical diagnostics equipment expects a resolution will involve a recall of unexpired lots of Triage products that don't satisfy a quality control release method.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM
  • SAN

    The decline in Madrid accelerates as economy minister De Guindos throws out the less than...

    The decline in Madrid accelerates as economy minister De Guindos throws out the less than credulous number of €15B as the maximum public cost of bailing out the country's banks, suggesting the government is loading up a pea-shooter rather than a bazooka. IBEX 35 -3.5%. Santander (STD) -4.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:52 AM
  • NVDA

    More on Nvidia's (NASDAQ:NVDA) Q1 report: Shares +10% premarket despite a 55% drop in profits...

    More on Nvidia's (NASDAQ:NVDA) Q1 report: Shares +10% premarket despite a 55% drop in profits Y/Y and a double-digit jump in expenses. Q2 revenue is guided higher to $990M-$1.05B vs. $979.1M consensus; non-GAAP gross margin is expected at ~51.5%. "Look for exciting news" at a tech conference next week on ways Kepler GPUs "will enhance mobile and cloud computing," the CEO says.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM
  • GILD

    Gilead (NASDAQ:GILD) +3.2% after an FDA advisory panel yesterday backed the company's HIV drug...

    Gilead (NASDAQ:GILD) +3.2% after an FDA advisory panel yesterday backed the company's HIV drug Truvada for use as a preventative measure in high-risk individuals, saying the risk of misuse or the of the virus developing resistance to the treatment didn’t outweigh the potential benefit. The FDA is expected to decide by June 15%. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:06 AM
  • T

    Leap Wireless (LEAP) +9.3% premarket following news AT&T was (and might still be) interested...

    Leap Wireless (LEAP) +9.3% premarket following news AT&T was (and might still be) interested in acquiring it.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:53 AM
  • VZ

    Verizon and AT&T get upgrades to Outperform from Neutral at Credit Suisse, which also bumps...

    Verizon and AT&T get upgrades to Outperform from Neutral at Credit Suisse, which also bumps VZ's price target to $45 from $38, and T to $36.50 from 30. Verizon +0.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:49 AM | 3 Comments
  • NVDA

    Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA): Q1 EPS of $0.16 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $925M (-4% Y/Y) beats by $9M....

    Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA): Q1 EPS of $0.16 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $925M (-4% Y/Y) beats by $9M. Shares +7.9% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:36 AM
  • SNE

    Sony's (NYSE:SNE) Japan-listed shares get a chance to react to yesterday's earnings debacle,...

    Sony's (NYSE:SNE) Japan-listed shares get a chance to react to yesterday's earnings debacle, closing down 6.4%. Shares had fallen more than 7% earlier in the day to a near 32-year low. Says one blunt trader: "There is really nothing in there that can justify buying the stock."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 AM | 2 Comments
